Tue, 07 Jan 2025 04:06:34 +0000 Senior Sergeant Lyn Fleming died after being struck by a vehicle on New Year's Day.

Richard Sivell a no-show in Tauranga court over threats to kill Dame Jacinda Ardern https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/richard-sivell-a-no-show-in-tauranga-court-over-threats-to-kill-dame-jacinda-阿德恩/Y2KQUBCBSNFANDOULXJYX4W6UA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/richard-sivell-a-no-show-in-tauranga-court-over-threats-to-kill-dame-jacinda-阿德恩/Y2KQUBCBSNFANDOULXJYX4W6UA/ Sandra Conchie'I’ve got a noose with your name on it,' he wrote of Dame Jacinda Ardern during her term. Tue, 07 Jan 2025 03:49:51 +0000 Richard Trevor Sivell, 43, was due for sentencing in the Tauranga District Court after being found guilty of threatening to kill Jacinda Ardern and two other charges. Photo / NZME
Gisborne District Council angered after sewer blocked by dumped garden waste; Waka ama paddlers can’t train on river https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-district-council-angered-after-sewer-blocked-by-dumped-garden-waste-waka-ama-paddlers-cant-train-河上/WMFTV3GBEVE43P5L2E43GFJ4MI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-district-council-angered-after-sewer-blocked-by-dumped-garden-waste-waka-ama-paddlers-cant-train-河上/WMFTV3GBEVE43P5L2E43GFJ4MI/ Murray RobertsonHealth warnings shut Gisborne's waters again after dumped garden waste blocked a sewer. Tue, 07 Jan 2025 03:41:08 +0000 Contractors working at Gisborne's Oak St pump station on Tuesday. Gisborne District Council said it was forced open the emergency sewer valve on Oak St into the Taruheru River on Monday due to someone putting garden waste down a manhole. Photo / Murray Robertson
Raglan car fire: Youths arrested after burnouts, attempted theft, antisocial behaviour https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/raglan-car-fire-youths-arrested-after-burnouts-attempted-theft-antisocial-behaviour/NFQ56A7YTBC7JBRWQWMQJI2DTQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/raglan-car-fire-youths-arrested-after-burnouts-attempted-theft-antisocial-behaviour/NFQ56A7YTBC7JBRWQWMQJI2DTQ/ A suspected stolen car was reported to police for doing burnouts at about 2.50am. Tue, 07 Jan 2025 03:36:52 +0000 Police have arrested seven young people after reports of burnouts, attempted theft, and a car fire in Raglan last night.
Oxford baby death: Mother accused of neglect named for first time https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/oxford-baby-death-mother-accused-of-neglect-named-for-first-time/XXR4SJLWWZGQZKKWC6NBFYQQEE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/oxford-baby-death-mother-accused-of-neglect-named-for-first-time/XXR4SJLWWZGQZKKWC6NBFYQQEE/ Kurt BayerTwo-month-old Kevin Chen died on August 5. Tue, 07 Jan 2025 03:24:14 +0000 Michael Steele with his son Kevin Chen, who died suddenly four months ago. Steele is now demanding answers after saying he raised red flags with Oranga Tamariki before the tragedy.

Pā Wars: Tuatini the overall champions in Ngāti Porou Inter Marae Sports Festival https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/pa-wars-tuatini-the-overall-champions-in-ngati-porou-inter-marae-sports-festival/VBMETCIHRNFYRFHBH7YAWLE3YA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/pa-wars-tuatini-the-overall-champions-in-ngati-porou-inter-marae-sports-festival/VBMETCIHRNFYRFHBH7YAWLE3YA/ An estimated 1500 people attended the event at Ruatōria. Tue, 07 Jan 2025 02:57:47 +0000 Hundreds turned out for Ngāti Porou Inter Marae Sports Festival, better known as "Pā Wars" on Friday. The overall winners were Tuatini. Participants are pictured lining up for a sprint race. Photo / Radio Ngāti Porou
DoC seeking public sighting of entangled dolphin in Auckland waters https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/doc-seeking-public-sighting-of-entangled-dolphin-in-west-auckland-waters/BULMWMYQIRAZPK46DEG654BB5I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/doc-seeking-public-sighting-of-entangled-dolphin-in-west-auckland-waters/BULMWMYQIRAZPK46DEG654BB5I/ Jaime LythThe dolphin was last seen at the Huapai Golf Course near the edge of Waitemata Harbour. Tue, 07 Jan 2025 02:42:11 +0000 DoC is calling for public assistance in locating an entangled bottlenose dolphin reported in waters around western Auckland. Photo / DoC
